Key Match Events: The Kings couldn't get any offensive flow going all game, finishing with just 19 assists on 37 field goals.
The Clippers paired a strong defensive performance with big games from Norman Powell and James Harden to get the job done against Sacramento.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings have found ways to score without hitting their threes, but going 3-of-26 makes it nearly impossible to win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings shot an abysmal 3-of-26 (11.5 percent) from beyond the arc, compared to 14-of-30 (46.7 percent) for the Clippers.
No one on the Kings was able to get going from deep, as De'Aaron Fox finished 2-of-5 and Keon Ellis 1-of-3.
The Kings have struggled with their three-point shooting, and it's been a key area of concern for the team.
Others: The Kings head to Phoenix to take on the 8-1 Suns, and they'll need to find a way to make more than three three-pointers to have a chance at winning.
